p: CD4 + T cell count, CRF01 AE subtypes, and treatment with “TDF+3TC+EFV/NVP/other” are associated with DR. No significant differences were seen in other characteristics. Previous studies have suggested that patients with initial CD4 + T cell count > 200 cells/ μl had better recovery of immune function after ART [ 34, 35]. The level of CD4 + T cell count may reflect the function of the immune system, and the patients with poor immune function, that is, primary CD4 + T cell count ≤ 200 cells/ μl, are more likely to develop DR, indicating that HIV-infected patients should be detected early and initiate antiviral treatment started as soon as possible.
